page.title: 17Technology-Dymchurch Seawall
page.content: The seawall was started by the Romans. The materials used were thorn bushes that were tied into faggots and then left to harden in the sun.The sea- wall that is standing in 1985 was be- gun in the C18.The old core is still there,but is not very strong.It is made of shingle & silt.The grating is tested every year on the surface & underneath to check that it has not started to crumble.To do this holes are drilled & gaps are plugged with cement.It is inspected every year.One hole in the seawall could take one month or one year to repair.It is 7.5 metres high and 50-60 metres wide.To repair the seawall it would cost Â£2000000 per mile.It was built to stop the Romney Marsh from flooding.The seawall is curved to break the force of the waves.
